page.title: 02Cattistock Village
page.content: The largest village is Cattistock;, which, together with the surrounding farms and hamlets, constitutes a Conservation Area in which new building is restricted by law. It has a main street containing two right-angled bends leading in opposite directions. The village square is actually triangular, bounded on two sides by 15th and 16th century cottages, some stone-built, some rendered, many of them thatched. Along one side is the churchyard, with the War Memorial standing just inside the gate. Also a well-head with drinking cup is in the churchyard.Behind the village square there is a small development of council bungalows providing sheltered accommodation for 20 retirement pensioners, with warden supervision.
